reviews.text: Our daughter attended cheerleading camp at Great Wolf Lodge. We wanted to watch her squad perform on the last day, but we did not make a reservation ahead of time since we were unsure of our schedule and arrival time. Because we arrived in Cincinnati earlier in the day than anticipated, we took a gamble and went to Great Wolf Lodge first to see if we could get a nice room at a reasonable rate. At the front desk Laura happily assisted my husband and gave us a wonderful deal. We were thrilled with our King Whirlpool Suite! The room and halls were immaculate. We ate in both restaurants, one for dinner and one for breakfast, and we were both very happy with each meal. At night we were able to step outside on our patio and watch the fireworks from Kings Island. Although we didn't use the waterpark, we had a great time seeing our daughter perform the next day. Our only tiny concerns were the speed of the internet (but it was free, so who can complain?) and the stomping and running of excited children on the floor above us, but again, it's a place for kids. so who can complain? It was a great overnight trip!
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: We have 2 kids (4 & 16m) and each played until they passed out! The room was clean, hotel staff were very pleasant and the number of things to do was perfect. We decided to stop and purchase snacks and food from a local Krogar rather than purchase food at very high prices on site. So I can't evaluate the food. The waterpark was great for the kids and the large number of lifeguards on duty was pleasing to see. The room itself was setup kind of awkward. The TV was placed on the credenza facing the wall divider in the room that separates the 2 queen bed area from the sofasleeper area....weird. Other than that the story time and kids activities and our overall stay was great!
reviews.title: Great Family Trip

reviews.text: Had about a 30 minute wait to check in at 4PM (check in time) in a very busy lobby. Wrist bands worked fine for us for opening doors and purchasing snacks/ beverages at waterpark. Many lifeguards, good sign. Kids loved it (ages 5 & 7).
reviews.title: Cool rooms, but paper thin walls & floor
NOT WORTH THE MONEY "BED BUGS"!!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: I HIGHLY recommend that you stay on the top floor. We experienced stayed on the bottom floor (1031) and a family of about 20 who must've weighed 200 pounds each were above us and doing the Olympics in their room beginning at 7AM. Either they were the most rude and inconsiderate people or the walls and floor are paper thin. Front desk was called but nothing improved. Things were vibrating in our room because of them. Live and learn...

My family stayed in the Grizzly Bear Suit. Room (2053) The room was not cleaned well at all. Check in is at 4pm. Did not get into our room until after 6pm. Was traveling with my grandpartents (70's) and my 4 year and 7month old. Front desk staff was rude (Hannah) After finally getting to our room I had baby formula that needed refrigerated. The frig. was very warm. Maint. came and told us we had to chill our items first then put them in there to keep them cool (what ?) Went to bed, got up the next morning and had itchy welts all over my thigh and arm !!! Was not sure what to think, brushed it aside and went to the water park with the family. It was very very hot and humid. Def. hotter that the 83 degrees like there advertising claims. Grandparents and 7month old could not tolerate the heat. Went back to the room for our final night woke up again with more itchy bumps on my neck and chest. Started to pack up to leave and by accident pulled the mattress cover off the corner of the mattress. To my horror saw BED BUGS in the seams of the mattress. I am a Registered Nurse and work in a prison environment. I have encountered bed bugs several times.My husband is also a Doctor and has had several encounters with patients with bedbug problems. I quickly finished packing and got my family out of there. Stopped by the front desk to report the issue. Was treated like I was an idiot. For the price of the stay it was NOT WORTH THE MONEY !!!!!
reviews.title: Great Rooms, Great Water Park

reviews.text: First off let me say that all the staff were amazing from start to unfortunate finish. They were pleasant and always very helpful. No complaints there.
reviews.title: Please Please be aware of this....!

reviews.text: Our week off was to be spent this way...three nights at the SHeraton Fallsview Hotel (which by the way was fantastic, highly recommend..) then three days at Great Wolf. We were in room 1077, which we liked for it's location, right near the waterpark, arcades, fitness center etc. We were disappointed with the room though. Dark in the room, mattress on one bed stained with who knows what. But we figured we came for the facilities so not a big deal...until we woke up on our first morning to find the room infested with cockroaches. Keep in mind this was a 300.00 per night room we rented. I actually managed to kill one to show the manager. I know roaches having lived with them as a student back in the day. There wasn't just one ....we saw many, both in our room and then in the ice room next door. Needless to say we cancelled our following two nights. The manager I spoke to apologized but didn't seem surprised, nor did housekeeping when she saw us packing up and asked why we were leaving.
reviews.title: Great Family Vacation

reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, this was a fantastic place for small children, ours being five and three. But to say we were disappointed would be an understatement. We'd been planning this week off for months. I'm not bashing the staff or facilities, just be aware of what you may find there. I will be taking this matter up with the Hotel here in Canada and head office. Unacceptable for this type of resort.
reviews.title: AMAZING!!!

reviews.text: Beware, because if you bring just one roach home, you could infest your own home, which is my big big fear...
reviews.title: Find a great deal or don't waste your money.
Had a great "wolf" stay
reviews.text: Good luck!

Our family of 5 stayed here one night before going to Kings Island the next day. We arrived before check-in time and they gave us early access to the water park while we waited for our room to be ready. The kids loved the slides and especially the water coaster. The room was clean and comfortable. We had a loft room and had plenty of space to spread out. The wristband keys are a very good idea so you don't have to keep up with anything while you're in the water park. We thought the food prices in the hotel were a little high, so we ran to the grocery store for some snacks and breakfast. We signed up for text message deals on our phone, but they only offered a few merchandise / spa discounts and no meal deals. We loved being able to take the walking trail to KI the next morning. Great family memory! The kids are already asking when we can visit again.
reviews.title: Our family loved it!

reviews.text: We were in room 3042, a kid cabin suite, the last weekend of July 2011. We had a wonderful time until I was feeding my 5 month old at 1 AM on our last night and saw a two bugs on the bed. I quickly grabbed two in a tissue and ran down to the front desk. I asked if they had bed bugs and was told that "these" bugs looked like ticks, not bed bugs??? Which, after research, I have found that one stage of the bed bug does slightly resemble a tick. They sent up security and the two men collected three or four more bugs. I wanted to leave, but was told that they didn't have any other rooms available. I spent the rest of the night sleeping in the desk chair and hoped that my 5 month old, three year old, and husband were not surrounded by bugs in the kid cabin. We also collected a bug to bring home to have tested ourselves if needed. We were told that they weren't sure what these were... After reading other reveiws on here, it sounds like they have seen bed bugs a lot in this hotel! They next morning we spoke to the manager, who told us that they would send in a third party to check the room out. We asked for a refund, since we didn't spend $300 a night to spend it with bed bugs!!! He told us that we would have to wait and they would get back to us. It's been close to 48 hours since we checked out and still haven't heard from the hotel. My husband has been trying to contact the manager, but hasn't had much luck thus far. We were given garbage bags for our clothes and they offered us $20 to wash our clothes there...no thanks!!! I'm terrified that after two washing of our clothes in hot water, letting our luggage sit in our hot car, and checking everything out closely that we brought into our house, they we may still have brought them home with us.
reviews.title: Great time but found BED BUGS in our room!!!

reviews.text: The waterpark, storytime, restaurants, spa and staff were great. Food was pricey, as we expected. However, I don't think I would stay there again!!! I would recommend you seriously consider spending a lot of money and having to worry about bed bugs. This past weekend completely changed my thoughts on traveling. Great Wolf Lodge Mason, Ohio needs to get this under control! We wouldn't have stayed there if I would have seen these reviews prior to our trip!!! My best advise if you do go...check out your room first thing for bugs!
reviews.title: Wonderful place for parents and kids!!

reviews.text: We stayed here the last week of June, coming all the way from Connecticut to meet friends from Illinois. We were nervous that the attractions and accomodations would not live up to the web site or the videos we saw on YouTube, but Great Wolf Lodge was EVEN BETTER than we could have imagined! The staff -- chamber maids, store attendants, life guards, bar tenders, chefs, waitstaff -- you name it, they all went above and beyond. One night, for instance, my overly hungry and exhausted 8 year old was having a hard time in the restaurant and one of the chefs called him over and told him if he'd eat his dinner he'd feel much better, and he would get a special prize from the chef (he cleared it with me first -- a couple of gummy worms!!) My kids loved the arcade and the water park, it was clean, and above all, the people were so friendly. My kids have asked me since then "When can we go back?" We're hoping to bring my husband with us next time -- this place has to be seen to be believed. It was well worth the 13 hour drive!!
reviews.title: Great family vacation!!!

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights in a loft suite on the fourth floor and had a great time. The maid service was a little slow but it was clean and very nice. Kids had a blast at water park and buffet at loose moose was great. Will definately be back. Stay away from Kings Island Resort across the street. It is the dirtiest,mold infested hotel on the planet. Worth the extra money to stay at Great Wolf!
reviews.title: Had a great time and want to go back

reviews.text: We stayed here with our 4.5 year old daughter on August 21.She loved it. We stayed in a family suite for an overnight stay.Very spacious.We checked in at 4pm.Check in went without problems.Waterpark is great for all ages.Lifeguards seem to be doing there job.Didn't eat at the restaurant onsite.So i can't rate on the food.Plenty of restaurants to eat nearby.Arcade area was fun for the little one.My daughter enjoyed storytime.
reviews.title: Great waterpark

reviews.text: My husband and I took our 16 month old son to Great Wolf Lodge to stay for a night so we could celebrate my birthday. We had the best time!
reviews.title: WE HAD A BLAST!

reviews.text: Reservations were simple and the check in process was quick and easy. A plus was that our room was ready 2 hours early so we could unpack and change for the water park right in our room. (All registered guests can begin using the waterpark at 1pm on the day of check in, but room check in is not usually until 4pm.)
reviews.title: Had an excellent time!

reviews.text: We had a king suite and it was very nice. The bed was comfy and they brought a pack and play with sheets to the room for our son.
reviews.title: So Much Fun

reviews.text: The water park was awesome. The lifeguards appeared very attentive and there was a lot to do for all ages. We werern't sure that there would be enough for our son to do, but there were lots of things to keep him interested.
reviews.title: good

reviews.text: Arrive at lunchtime, go straight to the waterpark, stay there till 8.30, do 90 mins of wand, grab a pizza (offsite is best) everyone will sleep straightaway, wake, breakfast, wand and then 8 more hours in the waterpark. My 3 kids love every minute. Great setting, Lifegaurds are fantastic. The rest of the hotel is a bit of a money milking machine though. Kids spa, Arcade machines, tennager spaces....all overpriced rubbish in my opinnion, but the core attractions are excellent and the rooms are clean and fun.
reviews.title: Kids love it....DONT DO MORE THAN 1 NIGHT

reviews.text: Try and find a discount online as it is expensive
reviews.title: Fun family spot

reviews.text: I took my doughter and grand daughters here for one night.
reviews.title: Great for families...awesome water rides

reviews.text: Although this was a fun-filled 24 hours there are some things that I would like to share.
reviews.title: Fun Place!!

reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at 2:00 and were told our room was ready. The norm is 4:00 to access your rooms. They let you start using the water park at 1:00 even if your room is not ready, just use the dressing rooms poolside and store your belongings in the lockers (not free) or in your car.
reviews.title: Lots of fun...not extreme

reviews.text: We head to Niagara every summer for a week, we have been staying at a small hotel on Lundy's Lane for the past 12 years. Every year I look at GWL but feel it is over priced and our two girls dont need all the bells and whistles to have a good time, they love the pool at the Candlelight hotel were we usually go. I had signed up for the GWL email at the start of the year and I received an email in april about a pre summer sale. If you booked early for July they had rooms as low as 169.00 a night, that is an amazing price for GWL so we decided to book and stay the 2 nights and then just drive up to our other hotel and stay the remander of the week. It was the best holiday ever and it was just the right amount of time to spend at GWL. When we checked in at noon on the sunday our room was ready, its was on the top floor with a balcony overlooking the outdoor pool and mini golf. We went straight to the pool after checking in, it was nice to be able to sit outside in the sun and the girls could go inside do a waterslide on their own and you knew they were safe, there are lifeguards all over the place. Our girls are also 9 and 12 so they are fine on their own. They had a great time on the waterslides and just checking the place out. We had dinner at the buffet that night and the food was pretty good, as what is expected at a buffet. The mini golf is alot of fun, its interactive so there is never a dull moment. It was $30 for the 4 of us to play but they after that it is half price with your receipt showen. The next morning we had breakfast at the same restaurant and it was very good, but we always find on holidays breakfast is our best meal. Lunch was around the pool. That night we decided to just do the pizza hut express and eat in our room. Alot of kids were at storytime but our girls were a little old for that. The next day we found our spot at the pool, checked out at 11 and stayed until 5. Then we just drove up the hill to our other hotel so we didnt have the 3 hour drive home, which was nice since we were tired from a day of waterslides. If you add the cost of 3 days of a waterpark into the hotel price we got an amazing deal. When we checked out it was 500 for the 3 days, that was all our meals, tips and minigolf. Very reasonable. The 2 nights, 3 days was good for us, any longer and I would of needed the advil !! Everyone that works at this hotel is extremely friendly and very helpful, you can tell they love their job !
reviews.title: Great stay at GWL

reviews.text: we stayed at the gwlodge.. on august 27 and 28th..we booked the wolf den room and found it was perfect for two 6 year old boys and two adults.. rooms were clean and very handy to get around the resort.
reviews.title: 5 star howls at the great wolf lodge
No need to leave the hotel.
reviews.text: we travelled with my brother and his wife and teenage sons and they loved it as well.
there seemed to be something for everyone to do or see or experience here. the kids and adults were all worn out and sleeping in the wolf den by 10 p.m.
reviews.title: Best Place to Stay

reviews.text: the storytime is great kids loved the talking animals, food delicious adn somethign for everyone here...even fussy kiids
reviews.title: If you're quite wealthy this place is good otherwise I cant recommend it

reviews.text: I was looking for a memorable trip for my daughter and our friends' daughter. Well, they loved the Great Wolf Lodge but for the adults, the trip was a big disappointment. We were glad to spend a large amount on a room (about $500/night, not including meals, which others have said that they received) because we'd read and heard great things about the hotel. I can only speak to my own experience when I say that the room not only looked shabby and "motelish," but it smelled like a locker room. We opened the doors but the smell never went away. I told them at the front desk but they merely sent someone by with some air freshener. I think the smell was in the air conditioning unit, and, perhaps the rug as well. Our friend was up half the night with allergies to what she thought was mildew or mold.
reviews.title: Real Disappointment

reviews.text: The room had a small refrigerator and a microwave but only had 4 mugs and no glasses (there were wrapped flimsy plastic cups), silverware or other amenities that are usually present with kitchen appliances. The Queen beds seemed a lot more like full beds.
reviews.title: This Lodge has gone to the Wolves

reviews.text: The lobby was always crowded with people, as was the waterpark. The noise in the waterpark was deafening but I suppose what could you do...
reviews.title: 13 yr old birthday party xtravaganza

reviews.text: The food was expensive and it was in the middle of nowhere so our options were limited. I think we had one of the worst rooms in the place, but I'm sure we paid as much as everyone else, if not more. Our patio was at the ground level directly across from the bus stop so when we sat outside to enjoy the non-smellyness, we had random strangers sitting not far away from us.
reviews.title: Everything's excellent there (except food prices).

reviews.text: If my room weren't so unpleasant, I'm sure the other factors would have been much less magnified. I left knowing that my 10 year old daughter had a blast, but that we would never go back and I will never recommend it to anyone. I asked about a comment card and the front desk clerk said that I would receive one. We'll see.
reviews.title: Great overnight stay at Great Wolf Lodge.

reviews.text: Spent 2 days, 1 night August 4th. 4 Adults, 3 Kids (7, 9, 12). Amazing time. What a place! Kid Camp Room slept 7 very comfortably. Very impressed with design of room - never felt crowded. Place was spotless, workers seemed very happy to be there and rarely passed you without saying "have a great wolf day". We brought Dinner and Breakfast for the first night and morning but were quite pleased with the food prices. Lunch at Pizza Hut was very reasonable and very tasty. Others ate at the Outside Eatery and again, good prices and good food. Very impressed with the waterpark set up on our last day without a room. Bathrooms/showers were clean and plenty. Free lockers were a very nice added touch - i don't think i've ever seen a free locker anywhere else i've ever been. And free parking (2 cars) Also - mini golf was amazing, 5.99/kid for 18 holes then second game 1/2 price whenever you feel like playing.(keep you receipt). I highly recommend this resort - wish we could have stayed longer and can't wait to go again.!!!!!
reviews.title: AMAZING!!!!!!

reviews.text: Visited in early August with a 3 y/o and a 6 y/o for 2 nights and 3 days although we were able to use the waterpark from 1:00 pm on day 1 until 9:00 pm of day 3. Both kids had a great time in and out of the waterpark as there were plenty of age appropriatte things to do ('shows' with animated animals, storytime, crafts, a Hannah Montana 'hoedown' complete with a dancing staff member who could actually do the dance, a great mini-putt course, a kids spa, a good arcade, etc). The food was good, not great but OK. We found the entire hotel (waterpark, etc) to be clean and well maintained. But our room did smell musty but it was otherwise fine (clean, with the usual hotel stuff like extra pillows, coffee, etc). The staff were fantastic! Helpful but not to the point of being annoying, friendly, excited to be doing whatever they were doing (or at least gave the illusion!), great with kids, and so on.
reviews.title: Great time!

reviews.text: Expensive as Hell but the kids loved it and we would highly recommend it to anyone with a large wad of cash to spend.
reviews.title: Had a very good time - the kids loved it

reviews.text: We heard a lot about GWL from friends and decided to give it a try during the August long weekend. Traffic from Toronto to Niagara was awful, so we got there much later than expected. We stayed for one night and paid $310. Our four kids (9, 8, 4, 2) all loved it! My older 2 girls went on all of the water slides, while the younger ones were happy to go on the smaller slides.
reviews.title: Great fun! ... if you don't expect value.

reviews.text: GWL lets you enter the water park at 1pm on check-in day and stay until 9pm on check-out (although you only get the room from 4pm until 11am the next day). At the end of the first day, the kids all wanted to stay an extra night. Fortunately, there were no rooms available because they were exhausted by 3pm on the second day and wanted to go home.
reviews.title: Too expensive and not woth it at all !!!

reviews.text: I took my family there (wife and 4 kids) for just 1 night. One night is plenty if you're able to get there early on the 1st day and stay late on the 2nd day. It was a weekday and we got there around noon and had the whole waterpark to ourselves (ok, maybe there was 1 or 2 other people there) for about 5 hours. In the evening the place picked up and got crowded so that's when we went to dinner. The next day we were able to enjoy the park until closing (which is 8 pm). Our room was very well maintained and we had no problems with it whatsoever. Besides the waterpark they have an onsite adventure experience where kids use a wand and go find stuff around the hotel ($$$). Of course they have a huge arcade also and the storytime was a big hit with the whole family. We didn't eat onsite and they do not allow/want you to take outside food into the water area, but there is plenty of fast food restaurants and sit down places nearby. They are running specials all the time so get on their mailing list and don't pay full price.
reviews.title: Fun Fun Fun

reviews.text: This was a all around bad experience from unattentive hostess, dirty tables at the restaurant to rude employees to each other not us.Then to top it off bed bugs! Not one phone call or e-mail from management after 4 calls and e-mails from me.
reviews.title: Horrible experience from service to Bed Bugs

reviews.text: I overall enjoyed Great Wolf Lodge...the water park was fun! I would not recommend the restaurants at GWL, the food is not the best! I think GWL is geared more for younger kids (especially Magic Quest) but the arcade is nice for teens (: and there are fun slides at the water park that teens would enjoy! Great Wolf Lodge is fun to go to once so we probably won't come back, but I would recommend it if you have never been. A great place to go if you have younger kids because they would have a great time! (:
reviews.title: A great place for kids!

reviews.text: Lots of family fun with our teen and tween sons. We stayed for four nights and had a great time. This was our second stay and was even better than our first. Other water park resorts should take a lesson from this one. We've been to Kalahari and Splash Lagoon several times each...but Great Wolf Mason is our indoor favorite.
reviews.title: Excellent stay...Great Wolf Mason does it right

reviews.text: We love the 'lodge' theme and it is done very well here. The water park has rides for all ages but with our 'older' family we spent all our time on the slides and in the wavepool. The water coaster, toilet bowl, and funnel slides are the best...loads of fun. Since it wasn't crowded, we were able to ride the slides over and over.
reviews.title: Kids loved it, but parents find it overpriced

reviews.text: Our kids just loved the hotel. From the water park to the arcade kids did not stop having fun.
reviews.title: Kids loved it!

reviews.text: The restaurant was good but a little slow. It is very large so I'm sure it's hard to staff.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: It is a little pricey but I was there on a weekend. That said we will be back.
reviews.title: A lot of fun for a mixed-age group

reviews.text: My husband and I took our three daughters to the Lodge for a birthday trip....all I can say is RIP OFF! DO NOT go to eat at the lodge as my husband found mold on his hamburger bun...for those prices there is no way that should be happening...my husband brought it up to the server she just starred and apoligized and walked off....really? Need to work on the management skills. Everything is all about extra fees to do wands you have to buy the game and all the whistles and bells, water park has restricted hours that are not ADULT friendly in the slightest and no matter what time it is, due to the paper thin walls, a child is always crying. I've gotten more more in all inclusive resorts for the same if not less amount of money. Do not waste your time taking your children here, save the money and just go to a regular water park!
reviews.title: About what I expected--nothing special

reviews.text: We stayed two nights in a family suite, two older adults, two young adults, and two kids (12 and 14). The room was mostly fine...though the sofa bed was rather uncomfortable, and the television was broken, which they immediately switched out with a brand new one.
reviews.title: Fun park, eat somewhere else

reviews.text: The room very nice. The indoor watermark great. Go when first open to avoid long lines. Food was better than Disney park food. The magic game available for kids was great do them and funny. My only suggestion is a larger laundry facility. My only warning people hoard the elevators and are not willing to share them or move over for you.
reviews.title: My thought this place was Awesome.

reviews.text: This is a fun place to go any time of the year. We tend to go during the week in the Winter for less of a crowd. It is a bit on the spendy side, but it's a lot of fun for everyone. The indoor waterpark is a bit on the warm side (for me anyways), but you get used to it. The waterslides are all top notch and everyone in our family had a blast. Howling Tornado is a great ride that we will remember forever. Food is excellent and service is top notch. Highly recommend for people of all ages.
reviews.title: Fun for everyone

reviews.text: My two nieces (11 & 13), my two daughters (16 & 21) all spent a great day/night/day at Great Wolf Lodge. The check in was faster than I remembered and we purchased for $50 an upgrade to their premium suite (2 bedrooms, 2 bath). Very nice room. The water park was perfect as always. Our only complaint was the change in the dinner menu. The kids were so looking forward to the dinner buffet and we were very sad when we found out it was gone! Signs were still up in the water park advertising it. Our waitress said most of the return guests asked about it. Other than that, the rooms were sparkeling, the employees were wonderful and we had a great time!
reviews.title: Great Wolf Lodge - a fun time by all

reviews.text: We traveled to the Grand Mound, WA Great Wolf Lodge July 7th and 8th. It was amazing. We traveled as a group of 11. 6 adults and 5 kids. The kids are 10, 8, 8, 4 1/2, and 2 1/2. They all LOVED it. The 10 and 8 year olds could do everything at the waterpark. The 4 year old could do everything except the Tornado, and the 2 year old could only do the kiddie stuff. The adults ranging in age from 27-55 loved every minute as well. We were all exhausted after one day. The rooms were very clean and neat and BIG. The entire property was well taken care of. Food was delicious as well. Before we left, we were already planning our next trip.
reviews.title: Awesome Awesome Awesome for both adults and kids

reviews.text: I read all the reviews before we went and was a little worried, I can assure you now that some people are just hard to please. My kids had a fantastic time and were totally worn out for 2 days when we got home!! Our party included myself, my husband, my mom and dad (nana and papa) and my 2 young children, 4 and 2. Though it will be more fun when our two year old is bigger, she loved the toddler area and it is a decent size for the little ones! She also loved the shallow end of the wave pool. My son loved and did everything! He is 4 and the only thing he couldn't do was the tornado so it was nice that he could do so much! Lifeguards are everywhere and overall seemed really safe to me. It got really busy in the middle of the day but we went from a sat to Sunday and even at its busiest it was not that bad. Maybe a 15 min wait for the Tornado. ( best slide there) the rooms are nice and spacious! Much better than a Holiday Inn like I read in some reviews. I found it clean and comfortable. The ceilings must be 14 feet high( strange for a hotel room) we had the cheapest room you can get,the family suite, and it was fine for all of us. The bathroom is tiny but who cares. the couch bed could be more comfortable but worked for the kids. The food and extras are of course overpriced but thats to be expected anywhere you go on vacation. you have to remember you are paying for the convenience factor. One night we ate at the resturant in our Jammie's :) the kids shared a kids meal, my husband had a chicken quesadilla ( appetizer but it was huge) and my parents and I each got a one time through salad bar ( not on menu, but only 5 bucks!) and were out of there with tax and tip for 40 bucks. We also ordered a pizza one meal that was good and fed us all for 14 bucks. I can see how you could spend a lot of money but you can also have a really great time even if your on a budget. my kids were too young for the magi quest game and the arcade is expensive. I would skip that
reviews.title: Kids had a great time!!

reviews.text: I was super excited to take my son here for a summer trip and the great wolf did not disappoint! It amazes me how people can complain about this place...people say it is expensive?? A king bed hotel room with pullout and access to a lodge and waterpark for $160 per night...large pizza for $11.99...come on people...in Vancouver, BC it would be $300 for the hotel and $25 for the pizza. Needless to say, we found the prices on everything to be very reasonable.
reviews.title: Fair prices and tons of fun

reviews.text: The trip did exactly what it was supposed to...to spoil our son and have fun. Getting the Paw Pass and Breakfast Pass is a must and saves money, as your kids aren't going to let you get away with not getting them some things.
reviews.title: The Kids Will Love It!

reviews.text: Rooms were clean, good size and the waterpark was awesome.... No its not west Edmonton mall or disneyworld or any other gigantic waterpark, but it was good for what it was.
reviews.title: A awesome place for kids and big kids

reviews.text: Every staff member was friendly and check in was a breeze. We went for 2 night/ 3 days....which is perfect. Any longer and it might get boring.
reviews.title: Pricey but fun

reviews.text: My wife and I each had a massage at the Spa with a wonderful women named Jan.
reviews.title: Overall review
